title: Helen Watson Buckner
text:
Helen Watson Buckner (1918 – February 21, 1991) was an American philanthropist. The daughter of <a href="Thomas%20J.%20Watson">Thomas J. Watson</a>, the American businessman credited with <a href="IBM">IBM</a>'s massive expansion from 1914 to 1956, she was born into great wealth. She died after a <a href="stroke">stroke</a> on 20 February, 1991.
Her engagement to Walker Buckner was announced in 1940.
She spent most of her life working with various organizations, including as a member of the <a href="Salvation%20Army">Salvation Army</a>'s advisory board, the vice chairwoman of the board of managers of the <a href="New%20York%20Botanical%20Garden">New York Botanical Garden</a>, a trustee of the <a href="Brick%20Presbyterian%20Church%20%28New%20York%20City%29">Brick Presbyterian Church</a>, and a board member of the <a href="Young%20Women%27s%20Christian%20Association">Young Women's Christian Association</a>.
